response: I can't escape the constant pressure to be perfect. It's suffocating me and I don't know how to break free.
Is anyone else feeling like they're losing their grip on reality? The expectations and standards are just too much to handle.
I'm starting to question everything. Am I really not good enough or is society just playing mind games with me?
It feels like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of trying to fit into society's mold of perfection. But who even defines what perfect is?
The more I try to please everyone, the more I lose sight of who I really am. It's like I'm slowly fading away.
I can't keep up with the constant bombardment of images and messages telling me I'm not enough. It's driving me insane.
I feel like I'm walking on a tightrope, constantly afraid of slipping up and falling into society's judgmental gaze.
Why does society expect me to be flawless when no one else is? It's an impossible standard that's tearing me apart.
I'm tired of pretending to be okay when deep down I'm spiraling into madness. Society's obsession with perfection is driving me crazy.
I need a break from the never-ending quest for perfection. I want to find my own definition of happiness and embrace my flaws without fear.
